author: Staff Reporter
text:
In the wake of the terror attack on the Pathankot air base, Chennai international and domestic airports were put on high alert on Saturday.

Visitors’ entry at departure and arrival enclosures has been ‘prohibited’ for the next seven days, according to airport authorities.

They said that though no additional forces had been deployed, those who were on duty, especially CISF personnel, were keeping a close watch on the passengers as well as their luggage.

According to sources with the Railway Protection Force, security at railway stations across the State has been beefed up and greater vigil is being kept.
title: Chennai airport put on high alert
